headline: Gerhard Richter on display at the Fondation Louis Vuitton
subhead: With 271 works − including rare loans − on display, this is the largest retrospective ever devoted to the German artist. It opens in Paris on October 17.

headline: Jean-François Piège, guardian of Paris's bistro heritage
subhead: To mark the 90th anniversary of La Poule Au Pot, the bistro he runs with his wife, Elodie Piège, the chef and former 'Top Chef' judge has published a book celebrating the institution and gathering its signature recipes.

headline: Taxing the super-rich? The 'Zucman tax' explained
subhead: A proposal to tax the super-rich by a French economist called Gabriel Zucman has taken center stage in debates about France's budget as Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu tries to stifle another governmental crisis.

headline: Denis Charbit: 'In Israel, compassion for the hostages justified indifference to Palestinian suffering'
